snippet: The Israeli minister of defense ordered the eviction of a group of Jewish settlers from a contested house, although the government has signaled support for more settlements.
abstract: Israeli police and border officers swiftly evict a group of Jewish settlers from a contested house in the volatile West Bank city of Hebron on the orders of the minister of defense; at the same time, however, the Israeli government signals strong support for more settlement in areas captured in the 1967 war; official support complicates any prospect of renewed peace talks as Israeli and Palestinian leaders prepare for a rare high-level meeting.
lead_paragraph: The Israeli minister of defense ordered the eviction of a group of Jewish settlers from a contested house, although the government has signaled support for more settlements.

headline.seo: Israel Evicts Settlers From Hebron House
headline.main: Israel Doesn’t Let Eviction Slow Push for Settlements
headline.print_headline: Israel Doesn’t Let Eviction Slow Push for Settlements
